intro: Gomesa pirarensis, commonly known as the Pirarénsis spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is known for its diverse and often toxic species. The plant features small, clustered yellow flowers and has a milky sap that can cause skin irritation. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough texture. Gomesa pirarensis is often found in moist, shaded areas within the dense understory of the rainforest.
